msContents.summary: One of six fragments of papyrus in the University of Michigan Papyrus Collection that once formed part of a tomos synkollesimos are gathered under inv. no. 145. These six documents list the workers who performed their penthemeros in different localities in the Polemon meris in the Arsionite nome from August 21 through August 25, 154 A.D. Due to the fragmentary state of the text we do not have the exact location where the work recorded in this text took place.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank

condition.ab: This light-brown papyrus is badly mutilated and the ink is abraded. Texts on fragment a (nos. 1-3) are still joined to one another, the first overlapping the second and the second the third.

handDesc.p: Written in a very quick hand which gives the text a "sawtooth" appearance. Parts of the left margin of fr. a is extant, measuring approximately 2 cm. All texts are written by different hands. A 9th hand has added each document's number in the tomos synkollesimos in the upper margin.

origin.origPlace: Polemon meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Caesar Titus Aelius Hadrianus Antoninus Augustus Pius

Heron, son of Heron, son of . . .

provenance.p: Polemon meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt (?)

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: "(9th hd.) 161. (1st hd.) Year 17 of Imperator Caesar Titus Aelius Hadrianus Antoninus Augustus Pius, Mesore 28th through the 2nd intercalary day. 10 (+) men have worked at the breach which occured during the rise of the very holy Nile in the 16th year for the - - - fields near the village of - - - in fulfillment of their obligation of the 17th year with respect to the embankments 100 loads for the ordered transport of stones of whom the individual names are, on behalf of Theogenis (?):;Kastor, son of Ones,;Apollo(?), son of Papontos, grandson of . . ., mother Aphrodite,;Ergeus, son of Philotheos, son of . . ., mother Thaesis,;Marres, son of Protas, son of [,;. . .,;Heron, son of Heron, son of . . .,;. . .,;. . ., son of Phaustos, son of . . ., mother Taalbis,;. . ., son of . . .,grandson of . . ., mother Segathis,;. . ., son of Phaustos . . ."
